str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To fast, abstain from food. From nestis; to abstain from food.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From skuthros and a derivative of optanomai; angry-visaged, i.e. Gloomy or affecting a mournful appearance.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hupokrinomai; an actor under an assumed character, i.e. a dissembler
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From aphanes; to render unapparent, i.e. consume, or disappear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To fast, abstain from food. From nestis; to abstain from food.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have in full, be far, it is enough. From apo and echo; to have out, i.e. Receive in full; to keep away, i.e. Be distant.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) pay, wages, salary, (b) reward, recompense, punishment. Apparently a primary word; pay for service, good or bad.
